title: Mappet
description: A scriptable, hot-reloading API Gateway written in Rust. It uses a custom-built compiler to dynamically transform HTTP requests and responses based on declarative configuration files, all with zero-downtime. This project will be released as open-source soon.
backendSystems: Custom DSL with a hand-written compiler (lexer & parser)
keyAchievements: Built a compiler for a custom Domain-Specific Language (DSL).
Engineered a zero-downtime configuration hot-reloading system.
Implemented dynamic, rule-based HTTP request/response rewriting.
Developed a high-performance, asynchronous networking application in Rust.

title: Grammar Art Generator
description: A custom compiler that transforms a user-defined grammar into a GPU shader. Running entirely in the browser via WebAssembly, it allows users to live-code abstract art generation with instant visual feedback.
keyAchievements: DSL design and implementation
Compiler implementation (Lexer, Parser, and code generator)
WASM integration for in-browser execution
GPU-accelerated rendering with WebGL

title: Anagram Engine
description: A full-stack application as a freelance project featuring a public-facing website for anagram solving and a private Angular admin dashboard for dictionary management, all powered by a high-performance Rust backend.
backendSystems: PDF and ePub parsing for dictionary sources
keyAchievements: Dual-frontend architecture served from a single Rust binary.
Secure, role-based access with a JWT-protected admin area.
Custom data pipeline for processing various file types into a searchable dictionary.
High-performance backend written in Rust.

title: Rates Engine
description: A high-performance computation engine that transpiles a custom DSL into native Rust code, compiles it on-the-fly into a dynamic library, and executes it via a web API.
frontendFeatures: REST API for compilation and execution
backendSystems: Axum web framework for API endpoints
Dynamic library loading for JIT execution
keyAchievements: DSL & custom compiler design.
JIT compilation to native code.
Dynamic library loading at runtime.
High-performance API with Rust.

showcase.title: Rates Engine Architecture
showcase.architectureSvg: <svg class="w-full h-full" viewBox="0 0 400 380" text-rendering="optimizeLegibility"><g><rect x="20" y="20" width="360" height="40" rx="4" class="fill-blue-100 stroke-blue-400" stroke-width="1"></rect><text x="200" y="45" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-600 text-[12px]">Client (API Consumer)</text></g><g><rect x="20" y="90" width="360" height="270" rx="4" class="fill-purple-100 stroke-purple-400" stroke-width="1"></rect><text x="200" y="115" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-600 text-[12px]">Rates Engine (Rust + Axum)</text></g><g><rect x="40" y="130" width="150" height="40" rx="4" class="fill-gray-100 stroke-gray-400" stroke-width="1"></rect><text x="115" y="155" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-600 text-[12px]">/compile Endpoint</text><rect x="40" y="200" width="150" height="50" rx="4" class="fill-teal-100 stroke-teal-400" stroke-width="1"></rect><text x="115" y="220" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-600 text-[12px]">DSL Transpiler</text><text x="115" y="235" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-500 text-[10px]">(to Rust code)</text><rect x="40" y="280" width="150" height="40" rx="4" class="fill-orange-100 stroke-orange-400" stroke-width="1"></rect><text x="115" y="305" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-600 text-[12px]">Dynamic Library (.dll)</text></g><g><rect x="210" y="130" width="150" height="40" rx="4" class="fill-gray-100 stroke-gray-400" stroke-width="1"></rect><text x="285" y="155" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-600 text-[12px]">/compute Endpoint</text><rect x="210" y="200" width="150" height="50" rx="4" class="fill-gray-100 stroke-gray-400" stroke-width="1"></rect><text x="285" y="220" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-600 text-[12px]">Runtime Engine</text><text x="285" y="235" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-500 text-[10px]">(Loads .dll)</text></g><text x="80" y="80" text-anchor="middle" class="fill-gray-500 text-[10px]">1. title: Musiter - Music Similarity Analyser
description: A full-stack web application that analyzes a music collection to find and manage similar or duplicate audio files using audio fingerprinting technology.
frontendFeatures: File upload interface for music collections
Interactive table to display similarity results
Custom audio player to preview tracks
Ability to delete duplicate files and download the cleaned collection
backendSystems: Python backend with the FastAPI framework
Containerized with Docker and Docker Compose for easy setup
keyAchievements: Developed a full-stack application from scratch that solves a practical problem.
Integrated specialized audio processing libraries to implement a content-based comparison algorithm.
Created a clean, responsive UI with vanilla JavaScript and custom web components.
Packaged the entire application into a single Docker container for portability and ease of deployment.

title: Movie Reservation Service
description: A backend service for a movie theater reservation system, built with Go, the Gin web framework, and a PostgreSQL database.
backendSystems: Go for the core application logic
Gin web framework for routing and API endpoints
keyAchievements: Built a complete, RESTful backend service from scratch using Go.
Implemented a secure authentication system with JWT and role-based access control (user/admin).
Designed a clear and versioned API for a real-world application scenario.
Demonstrated strong backend architecture with separation of concerns.

title: Desert Ecosystem Simulation
description: A p5.js-based simulation of a desert ecosystem featuring interactive behaviors of cacti, rats, snakes, and clouds, influenced by a dynamic day/night cycle and genetic algorithms for reproduction.
keyAchievements: Realistic ecosystem modeling with predator-prey dynamics.
Implementation of genetic algorithms for evolution.
Dynamic environmental factors (day/night, rain).
Modular and extensible entity-component design.

title: WebRTC P2P Video Call
description: A peer-to-peer video calling application built with Flutter and WebRTC, using a Node.js server for signaling.
keyAchievements: Implemented a full WebRTC P2P video call application
Created a signaling server to facilitate the WebRTC connection
Built a cross-platform application with a single codebase

title: Private Docs QA
description: A 'Chat with your Documents' application that allows you to ask questions about a private collection of documents and get answers based on their content.
frontendFeatures: Chat interface for Q&A with documents
backendSystems: FastAPI server with a REST API
keyAchievements: Built an end-to-end RAG application from scratch
Implemented a dual-embedding model architecture for flexibility
Created a configurable and user-friendly interface for a complex system

title: Wave Function Collapse
description: An implementation of the Wave Function Collapse algorithm in p5.js. It generates intricate, seemingly infinite patterns from a set of input tiles by ensuring pixel-perfect matching between adjacent tile edges. This specific demonstration creates its patterns using a simple set of two tiles: one blank and one T-shaped.
